sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "

Consider the figure given below. KLM is a triangle. N is a point on the side LM of KLM triangle such that \(\angle KNM = \angle LKM \). Given \(LK = 12 \) cm, \(KM = 6 \) cm, and \(NM = 4 \) cm,
itemize{}
\item Prove that \(\Delta KLM \sim \Delta NKM \)
\item Find the lengths of LM and KN 
\item Find ratio of areas of triangles KLM and NKM 
tikzpicture{}
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "In the triangles KLM and NKM we have
\[
	\angle \input[s1v1]{}\input[s1v2]{}\input[s1v3]{} = \angle KNM 
\]
\[
	\angle KML = \angle KMN 
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
So, we can write that
\[
	\Delta KLM \sim \Delta NKM 
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 4, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{KL }{KN } = \frac{KM }{NM } = \frac{LM }{KM }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{\input[s3v1]{} }{KN } = \frac{\input[s3v2]{} }{4 } = \frac{LM }{6 }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{12 }{KN } = \frac{6 }{4 } \textrm{ and } \frac{LM }{6 } = \frac{6 }{4 } 
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow KN = \input[s3v3]{} \textrm{ and } LM = \input[s3v4]{}
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "
Now, we can write
\[
	\frac{\textrm{area of } \Delta KLM }{\textrm{area of }\Delta NKM } = \frac{\input[s4v1]{}\input[s4v2]{} ^2 }{KM ^2 } = \frac{36 }{16 }
\]
\[
	= \input[s4v3]{}
\]
\newline
"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": ["L", "K", "M"], "text": "$$\text{$\angle LKM = \angle KNM ${given}, and $\angle KML = \angle KMN ${it is the same angle}}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": " "}, {"data": [12, 6, 8.0, 9.0], "text": "$$\text{$\frac{KL }{KN } = \frac{KM }{NM } = \frac{LM }{KM} ${since, the ratio of corresponding sides of similar triangles is equal}, and putting values and subsequently solving we get $KN = 8.0 \textrm{ and } LM = 9.0 $}$$"}, {"data": ["N", "M", 9.0], "text": "$$\text{Since, the ratio of the area of similar triangles is equal to the square of the ratio of their corresponding sides, therefore, $\textrm{area of } \Delta KLM }{\textrm{area of }\Delta NKM } = \frac{KM ^2 }{NM ^2 } = \frac{36 }{16 }= 2.25$}$$"}]
